Class Library

java.lang.Object
Library
All Implemented Interfaces:
ILibraryManagement
public class Library
extends java.lang.Object
implements ILibraryManagement
Class to represent a Library. The shelves and the clients are represented and there are methods to add publications/clients to the library.
Author:
George Paul

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private Vector<AbstractClient> clientList
    Vector to represent the list of clients of the Library.
    private int nextAvailableClientId
    int to represent the next available id for publications.
    private Tree<Publication> shelves
    Tree to store the publications in so that id's can be searched for in O(log(n)) time (if tree is balanced).

    Constructor method.

  • Field Details

    • shelves

      private Tree<Publication> shelves
      Tree to store the publications in so that id's can be searched for in O(log(n)) time (if tree is balanced). Disadvantage is that multiple copies of same publication cannot be stored unless same different name used.

    • clientList

      private Vector<AbstractClient> clientList
      Vector to represent the list of clients of the Library. Vector was so that clients can be address in O(1) time by id which is just their index + 1.

    • nextAvailableClientId

      private int nextAvailableClientId
      int to represent the next available id for publications.

  • Constructor Details

    • Library

      public Library​(int shelfSpace, int clientSpace)
      Constructor method.
      Parameters:
      shelfSpace - the initial number of spaces on the shelves available to hold publications.
      clientSpace - the initial space on the client list available to hold clients.
